marketNews.title: Rupiah Continues to Strengthen, Projected to Break Below 16,000
marketNews.content: The Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar strengthened again by +0.1% to the level of 16,415 today, Tuesday (20/5), following news that the State Budget (APBN) recorded a surplus in 4M25 after experiencing a deficit during 1Q25. Today's strengthening means the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar has rebounded by +2.8% since its lowest level of 16,870 on April 24, 2025. The recent strengthening trend of the Rupiah exchange rate is occurring alongside improving global sentiment from the de-escalation of the trade war and the weakening trend of the US Dollar. Improved global sentiment is also reflected in the JCI's increase of +18.3% as of May 20, 2025, from its lowest closing level of 5,996 on April 8, 2025, driven by the return of foreign inflow. Bloomberg reported that a number of analysts expect the strengthening trend of the Rupiah to continue, mainly driven by the weakness of the US Dollar and expectations of more prudent Indonesian fiscal management. The weakening of the US Dollar itself is suppressed by weak US economic data and investor concerns about the condition of US government debt, which causes investors to exit the US market as a form of portfolio diversification. TD Securities projects the Rupiah has the potential to strengthen by more than +4% in 4Q25 compared to the closing of the stock exchange on Friday (16/5) at the level of 16,440. Meanwhile, Citigroup Global Markets estimates the Rupiah exchange rate will strengthen to the range of 16,000 by 2026. ING Financial Markets has the most bullish projection, expecting the Rupiah to appreciate up to the level of 15,200 by the end of 2025. A stronger Rupiah exchange rate provides greater room for Bank Indonesia to cut the BI Rate. According to the Reuters consensus, Bank Indonesia will cut the BI Rate by 25 bps to the level of 5.5% at the Board of Governors Meeting on Wednesday (21/5). Furthermore, the consensus also expects the BI Rate to drop again by another 25 bps to the level of 5.25% by the end of 3Q25. Key Takeaway: With the prospect of a strengthening Rupiah amidst an early stage of foreign inflow trend, we assess there is room for further JCI increase, thus investors can stay invested. The increase in JCI driven by foreign inflow will generally have a positive impact on the Big 4 Banks, namely BBCA, BMRI, BBNI, BBRI. Furthermore, the strengthening of the Rupiah exchange rate will positively impact the performance of issuers with a large import portion, such as ICBP, KLBF, and MAPI.

marketNews.title: Other hot things you need to know...
marketNews.content: 1. The Ministry of Finance on Tuesday (20/5) released the Macroeconomic Framework and Fiscal Policy Outline (KEM-PPKF) for the 2026 fiscal year, which will be used in formulating the 2026 Draft State Budget (APBN). In the KEM-PPKF 2026, the government targets economic growth around +5.2-5.8% YoY, inflation around 1.5-3.5%, the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar around 16,500-16,900, a State Budget deficit around 2.48-2.53% of GDP, Indonesian Crude Price in the range of 60-80 US dollars per barrel, oil lifting around 600,000-605,000 barrels per day, and gas lifting around 953 MBOEPD-1.017 MMBOEPD. 2. The Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated on Tuesday (20/5) that the State Budget recorded a surplus of 4.3 trillion Rupiah or 0.02% of GDP during 4M25, with a primary balance surplus of 173.9 trillion Rupiah (-26.7% YoY). This result marks a turnaround after a deficit of 104.2 trillion Rupiah in 1Q25, equivalent to 0.43% of GDP. State revenue in 4M25 reached 810.5 trillion Rupiah (-12.4% YoY) or equivalent to 27% of the 2025 target, while state expenditure reached 806.2 trillion Rupiah (-5.1% YoY) or equivalent to 22.3% of the 2025 target. 3. Kontan reported that the Ministry of Finance will rotate Echelon I officials, with Lieutenant General TNI Djaka Budi Utama replacing Askolani as Director General of Customs. Besides Customs, Kontan also reported that Bimo Wijayanto will be appointed as Director General of Taxes, replacing Suryo Utomo. Kontan reported that Djaka and Bimo were directly selected by President Prabowo Subianto. Djaka currently serves as the main secretary at the State Intelligence Agency, while Bimo serves as an independent commissioner at Phapros (PEHA). 4. Petronas Vice President of Exploration, Mohd Redhani Abdul Rahman, stated on Tuesday (20/5) that the company is currently discussing with Pertamina and TotalEnergies to form a partnership to develop the Bobara oil block, West Papua. Redhani mentioned that discussions have been ongoing since last year, but no agreement has been signed yet. Petronas itself signed a production sharing contract with the Indonesian government last year to operate the Bobara block, which is estimated to have reserves of 6.8 billion barrels of oil equivalent. 5. China's central bank on Tuesday (20/5) cut the 1-year and 5-year loan prime rates by 10 bps each to 3% and 3.5%, respectively. This decision was in line with consensus expectations and marked the first loan prime rate cut since October 2024. This decision also followed monetary easing steps announced in early May 2025 to strengthen the economy and mitigate potential impacts from trade tensions with the US. 6. China's national statistics bureau noted that the urban youth unemployment rate (aged 16-24) dropped to 15.8% in April 2025 (vs. March 2025: 16.5%). 7. Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) plans to add business activities in the form of laboratory testing services and commercialization of two-phase fluid measurement technology through a product branded 'Flow2Max.' This technology is capable of providing accurate and real-time data on two-phase conditions (steam-liquid), which is the main characteristic of geothermal fluids. This plan will be discussed at the AGM on June 3, 2025. 8. MNC Kapital Indonesia (BCAP) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to approximately 21.3 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 33.33%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the raised funds are intended for working capital and business development. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on June 25, 2025.

tickerNews.title: CUAN Plans 1:10 Stock Split
tickerNews.content: CUAN: Petrindo Jaya Kreasi plans to conduct a stock split with a ratio of 1:10. The trading schedule for shares with the new nominal value on the regular and negotiated markets is on July 10, 2025. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on June 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: SMGR Cement Sales Volume in April 2025 Grew +37% YoY
tickerNews.content: SMGR: Semen Indonesia recorded cement sales volume growth of +37% YoY in April 2025, supported by domestic cement sales which increased by +34% YoY. Setting aside the effect of Eid seasonality by summing the sales data for March and April 2025, SMGR's sales volume still increased by +4.1% YoY. In terms of segmentation, the contribution of bagged cement sales rose to 74.7% in April 2025 (vs. March 2025: 69.4%) and 72.2% during 4M25 (vs. 3M25: 71.5%). During 4M25, SMGR's sales volume rose +1.2% YoY (vs. 4M24: -3.4% YoY), which is better than the industry sales which fell -1.3% YoY (vs. 4M24: +0.3% YoY).

tickerNews.title: MLBI to Distribute Final Dividend for 2024 Book Year
tickerNews.content: MLBI: Multi Bintang Indonesia will distribute the 2024 book year dividend amounting to approximately 1.1 trillion Rupiah, equivalent to a 100% dividend payout ratio, indicating a final dividend of 352 Rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 5.7% as of Tuesday (20/5). The cum date on the regular and negotiated markets is May 26, 2025, while payment is on June 19, 2025. Previously, MLBI distributed an interim dividend for the 2024 book year of 190 Rupiah per share in December 2024.

tickerNews.title: GoTo States Existing Commission Structure is Necessary for Driver Welfare
tickerNews.content: GOTO: Chief of Public Policy & Government Relations of GoTo Gojek Tokopedia, Ade Mulya, stated that Gojek's operations are running normally despite the online motorcycle taxi (ojol) demonstrations on May 20, 2025. Regarding the demand to reduce the commission or service fee to 10% proposed during the ojol demonstration, Ade said that this is not a solution to help improve the welfare of driver partners. Ade argued that the existing commission or service fee of 20% is used to finance various efforts to ensure the sustainability of order levels and revenue opportunities for driver partners, including promotions and discounts for customers, incentives, and driver travel insurance. Furthermore, regarding the demand to change the status of ojol from partners to laborers/employees, Ade asserted that the government recognizes Gojek driver partners as work partners and not employees. This partnership status, according to Ade, offers flexibility which is desired by the majority of driver partners.

tickerNews.title: ERAA SSSG Decreased in 1Q25 Due to iPhone 16 Launch Delay, Targets 250-300 New Stores in 2025
tickerNews.content: ERAA: Erajaya Swasembada management stated in the 1Q25 earnings call on Tuesday (20/5) that the company's same store sales growth (SSSG) decreased by -15.1% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: +6% YoY). This decline continued the weakening trend from 4Q24 (-17% YoY) and 2024 (-2.1% YoY), mainly due to the postponement of the iPhone 16 series launch in Indonesia. ERAA management stated that excluding the sales of the entire iPhone 15 series in 1Q24, ERAA's revenue in 1Q25 still grew +13.5% YoY (vs. 1Q25 realization: -4.6% YoY). ERAA is targeting the opening of 250-300 new stores during 2025, where approximately 200 new stores come from the 'digital' segment, 60-70 stores from the 'active lifestyle' segment, and 40 stores from the 'F&B' segment.

tickerNews.title: ACES SSSG Fell -2.3% YoY in 4M25 Due to Eid Seasonality Shift
tickerNews.content: ACES: Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia recorded same store sales growth (SSSG) of -14.1% YoY in April 2025 (vs. Mar 2025: +8.6% YoY, Apr 2024: +6.8% YoY), pressured by the shift in Eid seasonality. This result caused SSSG during 4M25 to drop -2.3% YoY (vs. 4M24: +11.4%), below the 2025 target which aims for more than +1% YoY. During 4M25, SSSG experienced a slowdown across all regions, with Outside Java at -0.5% YoY, Java outside Jakarta at -3% YoY, and Jakarta at -4% YoY.

tickerNews.title: DILD Marketing Sales Reached IDR 469.2 Billion in 1Q25 (+85% YoY)
tickerNews.content: DILD: Intiland Development recorded marketing sales of 469.2 billion Rupiah during 1Q25 (+85% YoY), equivalent to 23.5% of the 2025 target of 2 trillion Rupiah. About 88% of marketing sales were contributed by industrial estate segment sales, while the remainder came from the mixed-use and high-rise segment (7%) and landed houses (5%).

tickerNews.title: MARK to Distribute Final Dividend for 2024 Book Year
tickerNews.content: MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia will distribute the 2024 book year dividend amounting to 266 billion Rupiah, equivalent to approximately 93% dividend payout ratio, indicating a final dividend of 30 Rupiah per share and a final dividend yield of 3.7% as of Tuesday (20/5). The cum date on the regular and negotiated markets is May 26, 2025, while payment is on June 19, 2025. Previously, MARK distributed interim dividends for the 2024 book year in September 2024 and December 2024, amounting to 20 Rupiah per share each.

tickerNews.title: ANJT Secures IDR 1.6 Trillion Credit Facility from BBCA
tickerNews.content: ANJT: Austindo Nusantara Jaya obtained a credit facility of 1.6 trillion Rupiah from Bank Central Asia (BBCA), intended to support financial management and operational needs. This facility has an interest rate of 7% per year with a tenor of up to August 12, 2026.

tickerNews.title: NICL Targets 2025 Net Profit Growth of +104% YoY, Awaiting ESDM Approval for Nickel Mine Acquisition
tickerNews.content: NICL: PAM Mineral Director, Herman Thio, stated that the company targets a net profit growth of +104% YoY to 650 billion Rupiah in 2025, supported by a nickel sales growth target of +43% YoY to 3.3 million tons. NICL Director, Roni Permadi Kusumah, also stated that the company hopes the acquisition process of the nickel mining company, PT Sumber Mineral Abadi, can be completed soon to boost the company's production. Currently, Roni explained that this corporate action is still awaiting approval from the Minister of ESDM. Based on NICL's financial report in 1Q25, since 2023 the company has signed a conditional share purchase agreement for a 50% stake in PT Sumber Mineral Abadi valued at 650 billion Rupiah, of which 125 billion Rupiah has been deposited as an investment down payment.

tickerNews.title: Ministry of Finance Releases KEM-PPKF 2026 with Economic Growth Target of +5.2-5.8% YoY
tickerNews.content: 1. The Ministry of Finance on Tuesday (20/5) released the Macroeconomic Framework and Fiscal Policy Outline (KEM-PPKF) for the 2026 fiscal year, which will be used in formulating the 2026 Draft State Budget (APBN). In the KEM-PPKF 2026, the government targets economic growth around +5.2-5.8% YoY, inflation around 1.5-3.5%, the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar around 16,500-16,900, a State Budget deficit around 2.48-2.53% of GDP, Indonesian Crude Price in the range of 60-80 US dollars per barrel, oil lifting around 600,000-605,000 barrels per day, and gas lifting around 953 MBOEPD-1.017 MMBOEPD.

tickerNews.title: APBN Surplus IDR 4.3 Trillion in 4M25; State Revenue Drops -12.4% YoY
tickerNews.content: 2. The Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, stated on Tuesday (20/5) that the State Budget (APBN) recorded a surplus of 4.3 trillion Rupiah or 0.02% of GDP during 4M25, with a primary balance surplus of 173.9 trillion Rupiah (-26.7% YoY). This result marks a turnaround after a deficit of 104.2 trillion Rupiah in 1Q25, equivalent to 0.43% of GDP. State revenue in 4M25 reached 810.5 trillion Rupiah (-12.4% YoY) or equivalent to 27% of the 2025 target, while state expenditure reached 806.2 trillion Rupiah (-5.1% YoY) or equivalent to 22.3% of the 2025 target.

tickerNews.title: Ministry of Finance to Rotate Echelon I Officials: Djaka Budi Utama for Customs DG, Bimo Wijayanto for Tax DG
tickerNews.content: 3. Kontan reported that the Ministry of Finance will rotate Echelon I officials, with Lieutenant General TNI Djaka Budi Utama replacing Askolani as Director General of Customs. Besides Customs, Kontan also reported that Bimo Wijayanto will be appointed as Director General of Taxes, replacing Suryo Utomo. Kontan reported that Djaka and Bimo were directly selected by President Prabowo Subianto. Djaka currently serves as the main secretary at the State Intelligence Agency, while Bimo serves as an independent commissioner at Phapros (PEHA).

tickerNews.title: Petronas Discussing Partnership with Pertamina and TotalEnergies for Bobara Block Development
tickerNews.content: 4. Petronas Vice President of Exploration, Mohd Redhani Abdul Rahman, stated on Tuesday (20/5) that the company is currently discussing with Pertamina and TotalEnergies to form a partnership to develop the Bobara oil block, West Papua. Redhani mentioned that discussions have been ongoing since last year, but no agreement has been signed yet. Petronas itself signed a production sharing contract with the Indonesian government last year to operate the Bobara block, which is estimated to have reserves of 6.8 billion barrels of oil equivalent.

tickerNews.title: China Cuts Key Loan Prime Rates by 10 bps
tickerNews.content: 5. China's central bank on Tuesday (20/5) cut the 1-year and 5-year loan prime rates by 10 bps each to 3% and 3.5%, respectively. This decision was in line with consensus expectations and marked the first loan prime rate cut since October 2024. This decision also followed monetary easing steps announced in early May 2025 to strengthen the economy and mitigate potential impacts from trade tensions with the US.

tickerNews.title: China Youth Unemployment Rate Drops to 15.8% in April 2025
tickerNews.content: 6. China's national statistics bureau noted that the urban youth unemployment rate (aged 16-24) dropped to 15.8% in April 2025 (vs. March 2025: 16.5%).

tickerNews.title: PGEO Plans to Commercialize 'Flow2Max' Two-Phase Fluid Measurement Technology
tickerNews.content: 7. Pertamina Geothermal Energy (PGEO) plans to add business activities in the form of laboratory testing services and commercialization of two-phase fluid measurement technology through a product branded 'Flow2Max.' This technology is capable of providing accurate and real-time data on two-phase conditions (steam-liquid), which is the main characteristic of geothermal fluids. This plan will be discussed at the AGM on June 3, 2025.

tickerNews.title: BCAP Plans Rights Issue Affecting Up to 33.33% Dilution
tickerNews.content: 8. MNC Kapital Indonesia (BCAP) plans to conduct a rights issue of up to approximately 21.3 billion new shares with a dilution effect of up to 33.33%. The exercise price has not been announced, while the raised funds are intended for working capital and business development. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on June 25, 2025.
